article.headline: SC State tops Florida A&M 70-61
article.story: ORANGEBURG, S.C. -- Tashombe Riley scored 13 points, Greg Mortimer added 12, and South Carolina beat winless Florida A&M 70-61 on Saturday to open Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference play. Devin Joint scored 10 points, Darryl Plamer had four blocks, and Ty Solomon had seven assists for the Bulldogs (2-5), who outrebounded the Rattlers 38-35. Jorge Rosa led Florida A&M (0-9) with 20 points, Jermaine Ruttley scored 12, Craig Bowman 11, and Jerran Foster 10. The lead changed hands five times and the Bulldogs trailed 11-10 early, but pulled to a 40-24 lead at halftime behind Riley, who scored 11 points in the half. The Bulldogs scored 16 points in the paint and 17 points off of turnovers. A layup by Joint gave South Carolina State a 53-36 lead early in the second half. The Rattlers used a 10-1 run to close within nine points, 68-59, with 1:20 to play, but got no closer.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
